sentences.text: March 8, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Fellow Stockholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We would like to invite you to attend the Annual Meeting of Stockholders of Humana Inc., to be held on Thursday, April 20, 2017, at 9:30 a.m., Eastern Time, at the Companys headquarters, located at 500 West Main Street, 25th Floor Auditorium, in Louisville, Kentucky.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meeting will also be webcast via the Internet at the Investor Relations section of the Companys website, www.humana.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement contains information about our Company and the five proposals to be voted upon by stockholders at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please give this information your careful attention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This year, we will once again be taking advantage of U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission rules that allow us to furnish proxy materials to our stockholders on the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These materials will be available on the Internet on or about March 8, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continue to believe that Internet delivery of our proxy materials allows us to provide our stockholders with the information they need, while lowering the costs of delivery and reducing the environmental impact of our Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We hope you can attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, even if you are unable to join us, we urge you to still exercise your right as a stockholder and vote by telephone, mail or using the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote of every stockholder is important.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement is being mailed or transmitted on or about March 8, 2017, to our stockholders of record as of February 27, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kurt J. Hilzinger Chairman of the Board and Stockholder
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bruce D. Broussard Director, President and Chief Executive Officer and Stockholder
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why am I receiving this Proxy Statement?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are receiving a proxy statement because you owned shares of Humana common stock as of Monday, February 27, 2017, the Record Date, and that entitles you to vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has made these materials available to you on the Internet or, upon your request, has delivered printed versions of these materials to you by mail, in connection with the Boards solicitation of proxies on behalf of the Company for use at our 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your proxy will authorize specified people (proxies) to vote on your behalf at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By use of a proxy, you can vote, whether or not you attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement describes the matters on which the Company would like you to vote, provides information on those matters, and provides information about the Company that we must disclose when we solicit your proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why did I receive a one-page notice in the mail regarding the Internet availability of proxy materials instead of a full set of proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to rules adopted by the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission, or the SEC, we have elected to provide access to our proxy materials over the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that Internet delivery of our proxy materials allows us to provide our stockholders with the information they need, while lowering the costs of delivery and reducing the environmental impact of our Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, we are sending a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials, which we refer to as the Notice, to our stockholders and beneficial owners as of the Record Date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All stockholders will have the ability to access the proxy materials on a website referred to in the Notice or request to receive a printed set of the proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instructions on how to access the proxy materials over the Internet or to request a printed copy may be found on the Notice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, stockholders may request to receive proxy materials in printed form by mail or electronically by e-mail on an ongoing basis by calling Broadridge Financial Solutions, Inc., or Broadridge, at 1-800-579-1639.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How can I get electronic access to the proxy materials?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Notice provides you with instructions regarding how to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: View our proxy materials for the Annual Meeting on the Internet; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instruct us to send our future proxy materials to you electronically by e-mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choosing to receive your future proxy materials by e-mail will save us the cost of printing and mailing documents to you and will reduce the impact of our Annual Meetings on the environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you choose to receive future proxy materials by e-mail, you will receive an e-mail next year with instructions containing a link to those materials and a link to the proxy voting site.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your election to receive proxy materials by e-mail will remain in effect until you terminate it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When and where is the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Annual Meeting will be held on Thursday, April 20, 2017, at 9:30 a.m., Eastern Time, at the Companys headquarters, located at 500 West Main Street, 25th Floor Auditorium, in Louisville, Kentucky.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who is entitled to vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Anyone who owns Humana Inc. common stock, which we refer to as Shares, as of the close of business on February 27, 2017, which we refer to as the Record Date, is entitled to vote at the Annual Meeting or at any later meeting should the scheduled Annual Meeting be adjourned or postponed for any reason.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the Record Date, 144,284,497 Shares were outstanding and entitled to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Share is entitled to one vote on each of the matters to be considered at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What will I be voting on?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Election of the ten (10) director nominees named in this proxy statement to serve on the Board of Directors of the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A non-binding, advisory vote to approve the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers as disclosed in this proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A non-binding, advisory vote on the frequency of voting with respect to the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A stockholder proposal as set forth in this proxy statement, if properly presented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors is not aware of any other matters to be presented for action at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, if other matters are properly presented for a vote, the proxies will be voted for these matters in accordance with the judgment of the persons acting under the proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How does the Board recommend I vote on each proposal?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board recommends that you vote your Shares as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the election of each of the ten (10) director nominees named in this proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the approval of the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers as disclosed in this proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR ONE YEAR with respect to the frequency with which future non-binding, advisory stockholder votes on the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers will be held; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AGAINST the stockholder proposal as set forth in this proxy statement, if presente
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All Shares that are represented at the Annual Meeting by properly executed proxies received before or at the Annual Meeting and not revoked will be voted at the Annual Meeting in accordance with the instructions indicated in the proxies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How will my Shares be voted if I do not specify how they should be voted?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: f you sign and return your proxy card without indicating how you want your Shares to be voted, the persons acting under the proxies will vote your Shares as follows:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the election of each of the ten (10) director nominees named in this proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for 2017;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR the approval of the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers as disclosed in this proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR ONE YEAR with respect to the frequency with which future non-binding, advisory stockholder votes on the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers will be held; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AGAINST the stockholder proposal as set forth in this proxy statement, if properly presented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What if my Shares are not registered in my name?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you own your Shares in street name, meaning that your bank, broker or other nominee is actually the record owner, you should receive the Notice from your bank, broker or other nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, stockholders may request, by calling Broadridge at 1-800-579-1639, to receive proxy materials in printed form, by mail or electronically by e-mail, on an ongoing basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When you own your Shares in street name, you are deemed a beneficial owner or holder for voting purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you hold Shares through an account with a bank, broker or other nominee and you do not provide voting instructions on your instructions form, your Shares may not be voted by the nominee with respect to certain proposals, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the election of directors;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the approval of the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers as disclosed in this proxy statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the frequency with which future non-binding advisory stockholder votes on the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers will be held; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the stockholder proposal as set forth in this proxy statement, if presented.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Banks, brokers and other nominees have the authority under the regulations of the New York Stock Exchange, or the NYSE, to vote shares for which their customers do not provide voting instructions only on certain routine matters, including the ratification of the appointment of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the proposals listed above are not considered routine matters for this purpose, and therefore your Shares will not be voted with respect to such proposals if you do not provide voting instructions on your instruction form.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How many votes are required to approve each proposal, what are the effects of abstentions and unmarked proxy cards, and is broker discretionary voting allowed?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal    Vote Required for Approval    Effect of Abstentions    Broker Discretionary Voting Allowed    Unmarked/Signed Proxy Cards Election of directors    The number of votes cast for a nominee exceeds the number of votes cast against that nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No effect    No    Voted For Ratification of the appointment of the independent registered public accounting firm    Majority of shares present and entitled to vote    Counted as Against    Yes    Voted For Approval of executive compensation    Majority of shares present and entitled to vote    Counted as Against    No    Voted For Frequency of stockholder vote with respect to executive compensation    The frequency (every one, two or three years) receiving the highest number of votes will be deemed to be the choice of the stockholders    No effect    No    Voted for One Year Stockholder proposal as set forth in this proxy statement, if properly presented    Majority of shares present and entitled to vote    Counted as Against    No    Voted Against (2)  (1)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Under the Companys Majority Vote Policy adopted in January 2007, following election to our Board of Directors, a director is required to submit his or her irrevocable resignation to our Board of Directors conditioned upon
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) the director not achieving the requisite stockholder vote at any future meeting at which he or she faces re-election, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) acceptance of the resignation by the Board of Directors following that election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has 90 days after a director fails to achieve the requisite stockholder votes to determine whether or not to accept the directors resignation and to report this information to our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is a broker non-vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote occurs when a broker or other NYSE member organization holding Shares for a beneficial owner does not vote on a particular proposal because the nominee does not have discretionary voting power with
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: respect to that item and has not received voting instructions from the beneficial owner, but does have discretionary voting power over other items and submits votes for those matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed above, if you hold Shares through a broker or other NYSE member organization and do not provide voting instructions to your broker or other NYSE member organization, your Shares may not be voted with respect to certain proposals, including the proposals listed above that are not considered routine.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is a quorum?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A quorum is a majority of the outstanding Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares may be voted at the Annual Meeting by a signed proxy card, by telephone instruction, or electronically on the Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There must be a quorum for the Annual Meeting to be held.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Abstentions and broker non-votes are counted as present and entitled to vote for purposes of determining whether a quorum exists.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are four ways that you can vote your Shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Voting by any of these methods will supersede any prior vote you made regardless of how that vote was made.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PLEASE CHOOSE ONLY ONE OF THE FOLLOWING:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By Internet.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The website for voting is http: //www.ProxyVote.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to vote on the Internet, you need the control number on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each stockholder has a unique control number so we can ensure all voting instructions are genuine and prevent duplicate voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Internet voting system is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week, until 11:59 p.m., Eastern Time, on Wednesday, April 19, 2017, the day before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once you are logged on the Internet voting system, you can record and confirm (or change) your voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you use the Internet voting system, you do not need to return your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ) By telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a registered holder in the United States or Canada, you may call 1-800-690-6903.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The telephone voting system is available 24 hours a day, seven days a week, until 11:59 p.m., Eastern Time, on Wednesday, April 19, 2017, the day before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to vote by telephone, you need the control number on your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each stockholder has a unique control number so we can ensure all voting instructions are genuine and prevent duplicate voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once you are logged on the telephone voting system, a series of prompts will tell you how to record and confirm (or change) your voting instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you use the telephone voting system, you do not need to return your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3) By mail.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mark your voting instructions, sign and date the proxy card and then return it in the postage-paid envelope provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you mail your proxy card, we must receive it before 12:00 p.m., Eastern Time, on Friday, April 14, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are returning your proxy card to Broadridge, they must receive it before 10:00 a.m., Eastern Time, on Wednesday, April 19, 2017, the day before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4) In person.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mark your voting instructions and deliver to the Inspectors of Election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, you can vote by methods 1, 2 or 3 above prior to the meeting and still attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In all cases, a vote at the Annual Meeting will revoke any prior votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that if your Shares are held through a bank, broker or other nominee, you will need to bring proof of ownership to the Annual Meeting in order to vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I vote the share equivalent units held in the Humana Common Stock Fund of the Humana Retirement Savings Plan or the Humana Puerto Rico Retirement Savings Plan?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you have an interest in the Humana Common Stock Fund of the Humana Retirement Savings Plan or the Humana Puerto Rico Retirement Savings Plan on the Record Date, you may vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Humana Retirement Savings Plan and the Humana Puerto Rico Retirement Savings Plan, your voting rights are based on your interest, or the amount of money you and the Company have invested in your Humana Common Stock Fund.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may exercise these voting rights in almost the same way that stockholders may vote their Shares, but you have an earlier deadline, and you should provide your voting instructions to Broadridge.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broadridge will aggregate the votes of all participants and provide voting information to the Trustee for the applicable plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your voting instructions are received by 11:59 p.m., Eastern Time, on Wednesday, April 12, 2017, the Trustee will submit a proxy that reflects your instructions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you do not give voting instructions (or give them later than that time), the Trustee will vote your interest in the Humana Common Stock Fund in the same proportion as the Shares attributed to the Humana Retirement Savings Plan, or the Humana Puerto Rico Retirement Savings Plan, as applicable, are actually voted by the other participants in the applicable plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You must provide your instructions to Broadridge by using the Internet, registered holder telephone number (1-800-690-6903) or mail methods described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please note that you cannot vote in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your voting instructions will be kept confidential under the terms of the Humana Retirement Savings Plan or the Humana Puerto Rico Retirement Savings Plan, as applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Who will count the votes?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broadridge will tabulate the votes cast by proxy, whether by proxy card, Internet or telephone.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, the Companys Inspectors of Election will tabulate the votes cast at the Annual Meeting together with the votes cast by proxy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How do I revoke my proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You have the right to revoke your proxy at any time before the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your method of doing so will depend upon how you originally voted (a later vote will supersede any prior vote you made regardless of how that vote was made):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1) By Internet  simply log in and resubmit your vote  Broadridge will only count the last instructions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2) By Telephone  simply sign in and resubmit your vote  Broadridge will only count the last instructions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ) By Mail  you must give written notice of revocation to Broadridge, 51 Mercedes Way, Edgewood, NY 11717 or by fax at 1-515-254-7733, submit another properly signed proxy with a more recent date, or vote in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For written and fax notices, you must include the control number that is printed on the upper portion of your proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is the due date for stockholder proposals, including stockholder nominees for director, for inclusion in the Companys proxy materials for the 2018 Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder proposals, or stockholder nominees for director at the 2018 Annual Meeting, as permitted by SEC regulations for inclusion in our proxy materials relating to the 2018 Annual Meeting, must be submitted to the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Secretary in writing no later than November 8, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals should be submitted to Joan O. Lenahan, Vice President and Corporate Secretary, Humana Inc., 500 West Main Street, 21st Floor, Louisville, Kentucky 40202.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: May a stockholder present a proposal not included in our Proxy Statement at the April 20, 2017, Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A stockholder can present a proposal at the Annual Meeting (a so-called floor resolution) only if certain notice requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SEC does not directly regulate meeting conduct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: State law imposes only limited requirements, so meetings are governed by procedures set forth in our Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Humanas Bylaws require that a stockholder provide written notice of intent to bring a proposal no less than 60 days or more than 90 days prior to the scheduled date of the Annual Meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What is householding?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Householding occurs when a single copy of our Annual Report, proxy statement and Notice is sent to any household at which two or more stockholders reside if they appear to be members of the same family.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although we do not household for registered stockholders, a number of brokerage firms have instituted householding for Shares held in street name.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This procedure reduces our printing and mailing costs and fees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders who participate in householding will continue to receive separate proxy cards, and householding will not affect the mailing of account statements or special notices in any way.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you wish to receive separate copies of our Annual Report, proxy statement or Notice in the future, please contact the bank, broker or other nominee through which you hold your Shares.

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Humana is committed to having sound corporate governance principles and operates within a comprehensive plan of corporate governance for the purpose of defining responsibilities, setting high standards of professional and personal conduct, and assuring compliance with such responsibilities and standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sound corporate governance is essential to running our business effectively and to maintaining our reputation of integrity in the marketplace.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the heart of these efforts lie our company values, the guiding forces behind all our actions  Inspire Health, Cultivate Uniqueness, Rethink Routine, Pioneer Simplicity, and Thrive Together.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has adopted Corporate Governance Guidelines, which we refer to as the Guidelines, intended to comply with the requirements of Section 303A.09 of the NYSE Listed Company Manual.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Guidelines may be viewed on our website at www.humana.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From the www.humana.com website, click on Investor Relations, then click on Corporate Governance, and then click on the link entitled Corporate Governance Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Board and Board Leadership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The business of the Company is managed under the direction of the Board, whose members are elected annually by the Companys stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The basic responsibility of the Board is to lead the Company by exercising its business judgment to act in what each director reasonably believes to be in the best interests of Humana and its stockholders, while engaging in active and independent oversight of the management of the Companys business affairs and assets.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to fulfill its responsibilities to the Companys stockholders, the Board, both directly and through its committees, regularly engages with management, ensures management accountability and reviews the most critical issues that face the Company, such as approval of the Companys strategy and mission, execution of the Companys financial and strategic goals, oversight of risk management, succession planning, and determination of executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Oversight of Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While management is responsible for designing and implementing the Companys risk management process, controls and oversight, the Board, both as a whole and through its committees, has overall responsibility for oversight of the Companys risk management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The full Board regularly reviews risks that may be material to the Company, including those detailed in the Audit Committees reports and as disclosed in the Companys quarterly and annual reports filed with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to its charter, and in compliance with applicable NYSE listed company rules, the Audit Committee is responsible for discussing the Companys policies with respect to overall risk assessment and risk management, with primary responsibility for monitoring risks with respect to the Companys accounting and financial reporting principles and policies and internal audit controls and procedures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To accomplish this, the Audit Committee regularly reviews with both internal Company personnel and our independent registered public accounting firm the risks that may be material to the Company, as well as major legislative and regulatory developments which could materially impact the Companys risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee meets separately with representatives of our independent registered public accounting firm and members of management in charge of internal controls and procedures with respect to financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has also instituted a management Enterprise Risk Management Committee to assess the risks of the Company and coordinate with and report to the Audit Committee the results of this assessment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Organization & Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has delegated to the Organization & Compensation Committee the responsibility of reviewing managements assessment of the risks associated with the Companys compensation practices and policies for employees, including consideration of the counterbalance of risk-taking incentives and risk-mitigating factors in Company practices and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The goal of these processes is to achieve serious and thoughtful board-level attention to the Companys risk management process and system, the nature of the material risks faced by the Company, and the adequacy of the Companys risk management process and system designed to respond to and mitigate these risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Leadership of the Board is essential to facilitate the Board acting effectively as a working group to the benefit of the Company and its performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As Chairman of the Board, Mr. Kurt J. Hilzinger serves as Chair of regular sessions of the Board, runs the Board process and ensures effectiveness and collaboration in all aspects of the Boards role, and leads the Board in anticipating and responding to crises.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that the advisability of having a separate or combined chairman and chief executive officer positions is dependent upon the strengths of the individual or individuals that hold these positions and the most effective means of leveraging these strengths, in light of the challenges and circumstances facing the Company, which may change over time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At this time, given the composition of the Companys Board, the effective interaction between Mr. Hilzinger, as Chairman, and Mr. Broussard, as Chief Executive Officer, Mr. Hilzingers status as an independent director and previous service as our Lead Director, and the current challenges faced by the Company, the Board believes that separating the chief executive officer and Board chairman positions provides the Company with the right foundation to pursue the Companys strategic and operational objectives, while maintaining effective independent oversight and objective evaluation of the performance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications and Process for Nominating Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Guidelines contain Board membership criteria that apply to nominees recommended by the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee for a position on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has determined that each member of the Board (except Mr. Broussard, as a current employee of the Company) is independent according to criteria established in the Guidelines by the Board, and in accordance with independence requirements of the NYSE and the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The members of the Organization & Compensation Committee must also meet the outside director criteria of the Internal Revenue Code.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee reviews with the Board the requisite skills and characteristics for Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This assessment includes the desired experience, mix of skills and other qualities to assure appropriate Board composition, taking into account other Board members and the specific needs of the Company and the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board and the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee do not have a policy with regard to the consideration of diversity in identifying director nominees, the director nomination process is designed to ensure that the Board includes members with diverse backgrounds, including race, ethnicity, gender, skills and experience, such as appropriate financial and other expertise relevant to the Companys business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The goal of this process is to assemble a group of board members with deep, varied experience, sound judgment, and commitment to the Companys success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a discussion of the individual experience and qualifications of our board members, please refer to the section entitled, Proposal One: Election of Directors in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Identifying Nominees for Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board is responsible for selecting its own members and delegates the screening process for new directors to the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee, with counsel from our Chairman, our Chief Executive Officer, and outside consultants as appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee utilizes a number of methods for identifying and evaluating nominees for Board membership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee regularly assesses the appropriate size of the Board, the areas of expertise required to effectively contribute to the Board process, and whether any vacancies are anticipated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers potential candidates for director, which may come to the attention of the Committee through current Board members, professional search firms, stockholders, or other persons.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee selects candidates who possess a reputation and hold positions or affiliations befitting a director of a large publicly-held company, and are actively engaged in their occupations or professions or are otherwise regularly involved in the business, professional or academic community.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, from time to time, we engage a third- party search firm to assist the Board of Directors and the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee in identifying and recruiting candidates for Board membership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The policy of the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee is to consider properly submitted stockholder nominations for candidates for membership on the Board as described above under Identifying Nominees for Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the course of evaluating nominations for Board membership, the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee will look for individuals who have displayed high ethical standards, integrity, and sound business judgment, taking into account the current make-up of the Board and the specific needs of the Company and the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder nominations for election to the Board of Directors are governed by specific provisions in our Bylaws, a copy of which is available on our website at www.humana.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From the www.humana.com website, click on Investor Relations, and then click on Corporate Governance, and then click on the link entitled, By-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Bylaws require that a stockholder provide written notice of intent to nominate a candidate for director no less than 60 days or more than 90 days prior to the scheduled date of the Annual Meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If less than 70 days notice of the Annual Meeting is given, written notice by a stockholder would be deemed timely if made no later than the 10th day following such notice of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any stockholder nominations proposed for consideration by the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee should include, among other information required by the Bylaws, the nominees name, qualifications for Board membership and compliance with our Director Resignation Policy discussed in this proxy statement and should be sent to: Joan O. Lenahan, Vice President and Corporate Secretary, Humana Inc., 500 West Main Street, 21  Floor, Louisville, Kentucky 40202.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Guidelines contain independence standards to assist the Board in its determination of director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, to qualify as independent under the Guidelines, the Board of Directors must affirmatively determine that a director has no material relationship with the Company, other than as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the Guidelines, the Board undertakes an annual review of director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During this review, the Board considers transactions and relationships between each director or any member of his or her immediate family and the Company and its subsidiaries and affiliates, including transactions or relationships that are reported under Certain Transactions with Management and Others in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As provided in the Guidelines, the purpose of this review is to determine whether any such transactions or relationships are inconsistent with a determination that a director is independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In the course of this review for the current year, the Board specifically analyzed and discussed several matters:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) a relationship between the Company and Pfizer Inc., or Pfizer, for which Frank A. DAmelio, one of our current directors, serves as an executive officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) a relationship between the Company and the Thomas Jefferson University, by which Dr. David B. Nash, one of ou current directors, is employed as Founding Dean of the Jefferson College of Population Health;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) a relationship between the Company and MyHealthDirect, Inc., for which David A. Jones, Jr., one of our current directors, serves as a director, and of which Chrysalis Ventures, LLC, for which Mr. Jones, Jr. serves as Chairman and Managing Partner, is a greater than 5% stockholder;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) a relationship between the Company and JAPC, Inc., or JAPC, which is owned by the father of Mr. Jones, Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) relationships between the Company and certain of our health insurance customers affiliated with one of our curren directors or a relative of that director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pfizer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The relationship between the Company and Pfizer consists of a negotiated rebate based on the volume of prescriptions of Pfizer drugs obtained by Humana members, which volume includes claims paid by Humana for our members and the co-payments paid by our members for Pfizer drugs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These rebate amounts are significant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, these payments to Humana from Pfizer result from activity with many intermediaries over whom Humana exercises no control (i.e., the providers who prescribe these medications, the distributors who sell to the retailers, and the retailers from which our members get prescriptions).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the rebate amounted to approximately $119 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our subsidiary, Competitive Health Insights, or CHI, also completes various research studies for Pfizer, for which we were paid approximately $317,000 in fees by Pfizer in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also received voluntary critical illness plan premiums from Pfizer in an immaterial amount, under which arrangement the premiums charged and benefits provided are comparable to those extended to our other non-affiliated customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Thomas Jefferson University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The relationship between the Company and Thomas Jefferson University consists of a data sharing arrangement whereby CHI provides data to Thomas Jefferson University at current commercial rates following our standard protocols for use in teaching and obtaining grants and pharmaceutical-related projects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MyHealthDirect.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: MyHealthDirect is a vendor to the Company, for which services we paid approximately $193,000 in 2016, an amount comparable to other non-affiliated vendors, is not material to the Company, and does not represent a direct or indirect material interest for Mr. Jones, Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: JAPC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we provided hangar space, pilot services and maintenance for an airplane owned by JAPC, for which we were fully reimbursed by JAPC in the aggregate amount of approximately $556,000, at a rate at least as favorable to the Company as market rates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Health Insurance Customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we received health care premium payments from certain customers with whom one of our current directors or a relative of that director has a relationship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under each such arrangement, the premiums charged and benefits provided are comparable to those extended to our other non-affiliated customers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following relationships were included in this review:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Connecture, Inc., from which we received approximately $619,000 in premium payments, and for which David A. Jones, Jr. serves as Chairman of the Board of Directors; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Main Street Realty, from which we received approximately $283,000 in premium payments, and which is owned by the father of David A. Jones, Jr.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the conclusion of its review for the current year, the Board affirmatively determined that in each case the relationship between the Company or its affiliate and each director-related entity was not material, was below the thresholds for independence prescribed by the NYSE, and did not impact the independence of any of our directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each director recused themselves from the independence assessment relative to himself or herself.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consistent with these considerations, and based on its review of director independence in light of the standards contained in the Guidelines, the Board determined that each member of the Board of Directors (except Mr. Broussard, as a current employee of the Company) is independent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has the following standing committees: Audit; Organization & Compensation; Nominating & Corporate Governance; Executive; and Investment.

sentences.text: Audit Committee

sentences.text: Committee Responsibilities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to its charter, the Audit Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: assists the Board of Directors with the oversight of the integrity of our financial statements and disclosures and internal controls, our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements, the independent registered public accounting firms qualifications and independence and the performance of our internal audit function and the independent registered public accounting firm;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: bears responsibility for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the work of the independent registered public accounting firm engaged to prepare the audit report or perform other audit, review or attest services;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews with the independent registered public accounting firm, our internal audit department, and our financial and accounting personnel, the effectiveness of our accounting and financial controls and, where appropriate, makes recommendations for the improvement of these internal control procedures;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews the scope, funding and results of our internal audit function, including the independence and authority of our reporting obligations, the proposed audit plans for the year, and the coordination of these plans with the independent registered public accounting firm;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews the scope, funding and results of our compliance program, including receiving, at least quarterly, an update from our internal compliance department regarding any significant matters regarding our compliance with regulatory requirements and contracts with government entities;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews the financial statements and other information contained in our Annual Report and other reports to stockholders with management and the independent registered public accounting firm to determine that the independent registered public accounting firm is satisfied with the disclosure and content of the financial statements to be presented to the stockholders and reviews any changes in accounting principles;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: confers independently with our internal auditors, internal compliance department, key members of management, and the independent registered public accounting firm;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: determines and approves the appropriateness of the fees for audit and permissible non-audit services performed by the independent registered public accounting firm;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: discusses with management our compliance with applicable legal requirements and with our internal policies regarding related party transactions and conflicts of interest;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: discusses our policies with respect to risk assessment and risk management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: maintains free and open means of communication between the members of our Board of Directors, the independent registered public accounting firm, our internal audit department, our internal compliance department, and our financial management; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annually evaluates its performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to its charter, the Organization & Compensation Committee:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: reviews and approves our goals and objectives relevant to the compensation of our Chief Executive Officer, or CEO, evaluates the CEOs performance in light of those goals and objectives, and, either as a Committee or together with the other independent directors, determines and approves the CEOs compensation level based on this evaluation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: makes recommendations to the Board with respect to the CEOs and other executive officers base compensation, incentive-compensation plans and equity-based plans and approves programs for our executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approves equity-based grants to our executive officers and other associates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: approves material elements of all employment, severance and Change in Control agreements for our executive officers;

sentences.text: reviews and discusses with management the Companys compensation plans and policies for all employees (including the Named Executive Officers) with respect to risk management and risk-inducing incentives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ensures preparation of the Compensation Discussion and Analysis and the Compensation Committee Report as required by SEC regulations; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: annually evaluates its performance.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Organization & Compensation Committee acts on behalf of the Board of Directors to establish the compensation of our executive officers and provides oversight of our compensation philosophy, as described in this proxy statement under the caption Compensation Discussion and Analysis.

sentences.text: The role of the executive officers and the outside compensation consultant in establishing executive compensation is discussed in this proxy statement under the caption Compensation Discussion and Analysis.

sentences.text: Other than routine administrative matters, no executive compensation decisions are delegated to management.

sentences.text: recommends for Board approval candidates to fill vacancies on the Board which occur between annual meetings;

sentences.text: Executive Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to its charter, the Executive Committee possesses the authority to exercise all the powers of the Board of Directors except as otherwise provided by Delaware law and our Bylaws during intervals between meetings of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Committee does not have the power, to, among other things, declare a dividend, issue stock, adopt a certificate of merger or sell substantially all of the Companys business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Investment Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to its charter, the Investment Committee establishes investment objectives and policies for our various investment portfolios and investment options available under various employee benefit plans, reviews investment results, and annually evaluates its performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Policies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority Vote Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Bylaws, a director nominee will be elected if the number of votes cast for the nominee exceeds the number of votes cast against the nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In contested elections, those in which a stockholder has nominated a person for election to the Board, the voting standard is a plurality of votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has also adopted a policy to require the Board to nominate for election only nominees who agree that, if they are elected to the Board, they will tender an irrevocable resignation conditioned on, first, the failure to achieve the required vote for re-election at any future meeting at which they face re-election, and second, the Boards acceptance of their resignation following that election.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board may fill director vacancies and new directorships only with candidates who agree to tender, promptly following their appointment to the Board, the same form of resignation tendered by other directors, as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee will submit a recommendation for prompt consideration by the Board whether to accept the resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any director whose resignation is under consideration will abstain from participating in any decision regarding that resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Bylaws also require stockholder nominees for director election to notify the Company whether or not such nominees intend to tender the same type of resignation required of the Boards director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Directors Primary Position
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has adopted a policy requiring that a director whose primary position or affiliation changes must promptly notify the Board and the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee of the change so that a determination may be made as to the value of his or her continued service on the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Stock Ownership Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that directors should be stockholders and have a significant personal financial stake in the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, the Board has adopted the following stock ownership guidelines:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director must maintain a minimum equity ownership level of five times the annual cash retainer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares deferred at the election of the director are considered owned for purposes of the calculation of the ownership requirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any shares owned by a non-employee director (or shares received upon the exercise of options or vesting of restricted stock or restricted stock units, less an amount to cover the exercise price and/or current tax liabilities) must be held by the director until the minimum equity ownership level is reached and thereafter maintained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Once the minimum equity ownership level has been achieved, any shares received upon the vesting of restricted stock or restricted stock units, less an amount to cover current tax liabilities, must be held by the director until one year following the vesting date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ompliance with these guidelines is monitored by the Organization & Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Attendance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has developed a number of specific expectations of directors to define their responsibilities and to promote the efficient conduct of the Boards business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the level of commitment expected of directors and related attendance protocols, as part of the Guidelines, the Board formally adopted a policy that all directors should make every effort to attend all meetings of the Board and the Committees of which they are members, and the Companys Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Attendance by telephone or video conference may be used to facilitate a Directors attendance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, the Board of Directors met 19 times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors attended at least 75% of the scheduled Board of Directors meetings and meetings held by Committees of which they were members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All director nominees attended the Annual Meeting of Stockholders held on April 21, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Sessions of Non-Management Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, our non-management directors held regularly scheduled, formal executive meetings, separate from management and led by our Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional executive sessions of the Board are held as necessary or appropriate or upon the request of the Chairman, the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee or any two other non-management directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our non-management directors who qualify as independent within the meaning of our director independence guidelines meet in executive session at least once annually, and, in fact, met in 2016 in connection with each regularly scheduled Board of Directors meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Ethics and Code of Business Conduct
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has adopted the Code of Conduct for the Chief Executive Officer and Senior Financial Officers, which we refer to as the Executive Code of Ethics, violations of which are reported to the Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we operate under the omnibus Humana Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ethics Every Day, which we refer to as the Code of Ethics, which applies to all associates (including executive officers) and directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Humana Ethics Office is responsible for the design and enforcement of our ethics policies, the goal of which is to create a workplace climate in which ethics is so integral to day-to-day operations that ethical behavior is self-enforcing.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All employees are required annually to review and affirm in writing their acceptance of the Code of Ethics.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code of Ethics and the Executive Code of Ethics may be viewed on our website at www.humana.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any waiver for directors or executive officers from the provisions of the Code of Ethics or the Executive Code of Ethics must be made by the Board of Directors, and will be disclosed within four days of the waiver on our website at www.humana.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To see either the Code of Ethics or the Executive Code of Ethics or any waivers to either policy, go to www.humana.com, then click on Investor Relations, then click on Corporate Governance, and then click on the relevant link.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Policy Regarding Transactions in Company Securities
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has a policy prohibiting all associates (including executive officers) from hedging or pledging transactions using Company stock, including: (1) engaging in short sales of Company securities; (2) engaging in transactions in puts, calls or other derivative securities designed to hedge or offset any decrease in the market value of the Companys equity securities, on an exchange or in any other organized market; or (3) engaging in certain monetization transactions, including holding Company securities in margin accounts or pledging Company securities as collateral.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy also applies to all directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Communication with Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders and other interested parties may communicate directly with our Chairman, non-management directors as a group, or any other individual director by writing to the special e-mail address published on our website at www.humana.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, interested parties may visit our website at http://apps.humana.com/bod/contact.asp, where instructions for contacting these persons are available.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors have access to this e-mail address.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use the staff of our Corporate Secretary to review correspondence received in this manner, and to filter advertisements, solicitations, spam, and other such items.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Concerns related to accounting, internal controls or auditing matters are required to be brought immediately to the attention of our General Counsel and the Board and handled in accordance with procedures established by the Audit Committee with respect to such matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Skills & Qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating a director candidate, the Committee considers factors that are in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders, including the knowledge, experience, integrity and judgment of each candidate, the potential contribution of each candidate to the diversity of backgrounds, experience and competencies which the Board desires to have represented, each candidates ability to devote sufficient time and effort to his or her duties as a director, independence and willingness to consider all strategic proposals, and any core competencies or technical expertise necessary to staff Board committees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee assesses whether a candidate possesses the integrity, business judgment, knowledge, experience, skills and expertise that are likely to enhance the Boards ability to manage and direct the affairs and business of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the current Board members not only have and demonstrate these attributes, but also have a deep commitment to the Companys success, as evidenced by the key qualifications, skills and experiences of each director described below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The information given in this proxy statement concerning the nominees is based upon statements made or confirmed to the Company by or on behalf of the nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Nominees Biographies
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Kurt J. Hilzinger was initially elected to the Board in July 2003, and was elected Chairman of the Board effective January 1, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hilzinger served as Lead Director from August 2010 until his appointment as Chairman.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hilzinger is a Partner at Court Square Capital Partners, LP, having held this position since November 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that, he was a Director of AmerisourceBergen Corporation from March 2004 to November 2007; and was also President and Chief Operating Officer of AmerisourceBergen Corporation from October 2002 to November 2007, having previously served as its Executive Vice President and Chief Operating Officer from August 2001 to October 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hilzinger is also a director of Oncobiologics, Inc. and National Seating and Mobility, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Mr. Hilzinger is a strong operating executive with a finance and strategic background, whose operational experience and financial expertise in the health care sector contributes valuable insight to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bruce D. Broussard was appointed President and Chief Executive Officer of the Company, and elected to our Board of Directors, in each case effective January 1, 2013, completing a year-long transition plan to the Chief Executive Officer role.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Broussard joined Humana as President in December 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining Humana, Mr. Broussard was Chief Executive Officer of McKesson Specialty/US Oncology, Inc. (US Oncology was purchased by McKesson in December 2010).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At US Oncology, he served in a number of senior executive roles, including Chief Financial Officer, President, Chief Executive Officer and Chairman of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Broussard is also a director of KeyCorp, a member of the Business Roundtable, and a member of the Board of Directors of Americas Health Insurance Plans (AHIP), also serving on AHIPs Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Mr. Broussards wide range of executive leadership experience in publicly traded and private organizations within a variety of healthcare sectors, including oncology, pharmaceuticals, assisted living/senior housing, home care, physician practice management, surgical centers, and dental networks, as well as his in-depth knowledge of the Companys operations, finances and strategy, brings valuable insight to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Frank A. DAmelio was initially elected to the Board in September 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is Executive Vice President, Business Operations and Chief Financial Officer of Pfizer Inc, having held this position since December 2010, and having served as Chief Financial Officer since September 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that, Mr. DAmelio was Senior Executive Vice President of Integration and Chief Administrative Officer at Alcatel-Lucent from December 2006 to August 2007, and Chief Operating Officer of Lucent Technologies Inc. from February 2006 to November 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From May 2001 until January 2006, he was Executive Vice President, Administration and Chief Financial Officer of Lucent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. DAmelio also serves on the Board of Directors of Zoetis, Inc. and on the board of the Independent College Fund of New Jersey.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Mr. DAmelios skills, global experience and proven leadership in both financial and operational roles contribute greatly to the Boards composition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a senior executive at various global companies undergoing the kind of rapid and complex changes that the Company has undertaken in response to the rapidly changing markets and regulatory environment, Mr. DAmelio has extensive knowledge of the capital markets as well as broad experience working with the investment community, regulatory bodies and rating agencies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: W. Roy Dunbar was initially elected to the Board in April 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dunbar was the Chairman of the Board of NetworkSolutions, and was the Chief Executive Officer from January 2008 to November 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dunbar also served as the President of Global Technology and Operations for MasterCard Incorporated from September 2004 until January 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dunbar worked at Eli Lilly and Company for 14 years, latterly as President of Intercontinental Operations from 2003 until he joined MasterCard, and Chief Information Officer from 1999 to 2003.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Mr. Dunbars innovative, consumer-focused approach to information technology at a variety of global companies brings a valuable advantage to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board benefits from Mr. Dunbars expertise in leading companies focused on the development of information systems that are easy for consumers to understand and use effectively, which is critical to the Companys extension of its position as a leader in health care information technology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Dunbars extensive experience in health care over three decades further contributes to the strategic composition of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: David A. Jones, Jr. was initially elected to the Board in May 1993 and served as Chairman of the Board of the Company from April 2005 through August 2010, and Vice Chairman of the Board from September 1996 through April 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is chairman and managing partner of Chrysalis Ventures, LLC, headquartered in Louisville, Kentucky, and also serves on the Board of Directors of Connecture, Inc. (NASDAQ: CNXR) and MyHealthDirect, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a successful venture capitalist, the Board believes that Mr. Jones brings strategic insight and leadership and a wealth of experience in health care to the Board, both in the Companys core businesses as well as in emerging technologies and business models.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: William J. McDonald was initially elected to the Board in October 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. McDonald is the managing partner of Wild Irishman Advisory, LLC, a marketing consulting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that, he was Executive Vice President, Brand Management of Capital One Financial Corporation, having held that position from 1998 until his retirement in 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Mr. McDonalds service in various senior executive marketing positions contributes significant experience and expertise in brand development, marketing and related disciplines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: William E. Mitchell was initially elected to the Board in April 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mitchell is the managing partner of Sequel Venture Partners, LLC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that, Mr. Mitchell served as the Chairman of the Board of Directors of Arrow Electronics, Inc. from May 2006 until December 31, 2009, and also served as President and Chief Executive Officer of Arrow Electronics, Inc. from February 2003 to May 1, 2009.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Mitchell serves on the Board of Directors of Rogers Corporation, and previously served on the Board of Directors of Brown-Forman Corporation and Spansion, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also serves as Presiding Director of Veritiv, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Mr. Mitchells insights and experience running a complex global public company, as well as his significant experience in the governance of large publicly-traded corporations, will be valuable in helping to guide the Company in the years ahead.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: David B. Nash, M.D. was initially elected to the Board effective January 1, 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is the founding dean of the Jefferson College of Population Health, located on the campus of Thomas Jefferson University in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, having taken that position in 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Dr. Nash was the Chairman of the Department of Health Policy of the Jefferson Medical College from 2003 until 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Nash also serves on the board of directors of Vestagen Specialty Textiles, and the medical advisory board of Medivo Inc., and previously served on the boards of Itrax Corporation and InforMedix.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Dr. Nash brings a unique and compelling set of attributes that enhance the Companys ability to help people achieve lifelong well-being.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a widely recognized innovator in an emerging medical discipline that unites population health, health policy, and individual health, Dr. Nash is internationally recognized for his work in outcomes management, medical staff development and quality-of-care improvement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: James J. OBrien was initially elected to the Board in April 2006.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until his retirement on December 31, 2014, Mr. OBrien was the Chairman of the Board and Chief Executive Officer of Ashland Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to being named to this position, Mr. OBrien was President and Chief Operating Officer of Ashland Inc., and before that, Senior Vice President and Group Operating Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He also serves on the Board of Directors of Albemarle Corporation, Wesco International, Inc. and Eastman Chemical Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a highly respected leader in the global business community with an extraordinary track record of success, the Board believes that Mr. OBriens breadth of management experience adds valuable expertise and insight to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Marissa T. Peterson was initially elected to the Board in August 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Peterson is President and Chief Executive Officer of Mission Peak Executive Consulting, which provides client-focused executive coaching and management consulting services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Peterson was formerly Executive Vice President, Worldwide Operations, Services & Customer Advocacy for Sun Microsystems Inc. in Santa Clara, California, until her retirement in 2005 after 17 years with the company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Peterson currently serves as the Chairman of the Board of Oclaro, Inc., and a board member of Ansell Limited, and previously served on the board of directors of SUPERVALU INC., and Lucile Packard Childrens Hospital at Stanford, and the board of trustees of Kettering University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. Peterson holds an honorary doctorate in management and a bachelors degree in engineering from Kettering University where she graduated magna cum laude.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She received her MBA from Harvard Business School with the distinction of being a GM Fellow.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that Ms. Petersons operating and consumer-focused leadership, and experience developing and managing programs designed to help companies reduce the time, cost and risk of transforming their businesses by leveraging technology to architect, implement and maintain customers network computing infrastructures, bring valuable insights to the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Her commitment to a customer first ethic at Sun Microsystems Inc. established an industry leadership position for high quality and cost-effective product execution to a global customer base, a commitment that aligns with the Companys focus on consumerism.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis presents in detail our compensation policies and practices, describing each element of compensation and the decision-making process that supports it.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It addresses how we compensate our Named Executive Officers, and how we uphold our compensation philosophy through a governance system that includes internal oversight as well as expert independent outside review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our compensation policies and practices achieve our compensation goals, and that the total mix of compensation provided to our Named Executive Officers is consistent with a philosophy of motivating and rewarding for actual achievements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this proxy statement, we refer to our Named Executive Officers, or NEOs, which include

sentences.text: (ii) Brian A. Kane, our Chief Financial Officer, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
