sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Humanas Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation program supports our philosophy that compensation should be market-based, competency-paced and contribution-driven.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We design our programs to challenge participants as well as reward them for superior performance for our Company and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our compensation program must:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Align executives interests with those of our stockholders by including a significant portion of executive pay that is at-risk dependent upon performance in the form of both annual incentive awards that are paid, if at all, based on Company financial and operating results, and, in the case of longer term incentive awards, tied closely to changes in the Companys stock price, and financial, operating or strategic metrics;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provide appropriate rewards for financial and individual performance in support of our business strategy, while requiring an appropriate evaluation of risks; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Be market-competitive to attract, motivate and retain highly qualified executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Humanas 2016 Performance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Humana is a leading health and well-being company focused on making it easy for people to achieve their best health with clinical excellence through coordinated care.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our strategy integrates care delivery, the member experience, and clinical and consumer insights to encourage engagement, behavior change, proactive clinical outreach and wellness for the millions of people we serve across the country.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our strategy puts the consumer at the center, enhancing the consumer experience as our capabilities, partnerships and tools are all woven together and informed by insights and technology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Enabled by our integrated care delivery strategy, our bold goal is to improve the health of the communities we serve 20 percent by 2020 by making it easy for people to achieve their best health.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Despite an extremely challenging operating environment due to our proposed merger agreement with Aetna Inc., we reported 2016 adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $9.57 (excluding transaction and integration costs associated with the proposed transaction with Aetna, amortization expense for identifiable Intangibles, the write-off of risk corridor receivables established under the Affordable Care Act, and strengthening of reserves associated with our closed block of long-term care policies).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These results exceeded managements initial adjusted EPS guidance for the full year 2016 of at least $8.85, as we increased our public earnings estimates twice over the course of the year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our results for 2016 demonstrate the power of our integrated care delivery model, which keeps the consumer in the forefront of our clinical efforts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We were able to maintain this operating discipline and produce exceptional results despite an extended period of regulatory review of our proposed transaction with Aetna, which created significant uncertainty for our associates and our business prospects.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Historically, we have delivered significant stock price appreciation, while also returning capital to our stockholders in the form of dividends and share repurchases:

sentences.text: Results Under Our 2016 Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We operated under extremely challenging conditions during 2016 due to the proposed transaction with Aetna and certain terms of the merger agreement, which limited our ability to alter our compensation programs:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the protracted regulatory review process in connection with our proposed merger with Aetna created an environment  extended uncertainty for our associates which put significant strain on our ability to retain our top talent;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: we dedicated significant efforts supporting the regulatory review process and developing plans for a successful integration for the proposed merger; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: certain terms in our merger agreement with Aetna limited our ability to alter our compensation program, specifically limitations on:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our ability to enter into employment, change in control, retention, severance or termination arrangements with our associates, including our executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the aggregate amount of equity compensation awards we were able to make during the year;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: increases in base salary for our associates, including our executive officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: our ability to make material changes to our ongoing compensation and benefits programs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our associates are critical to our success and maintaining a strong talent base during a period of significant uncertainty created by the lengthy regulatory review process was essential to our future success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While it is not our intention to shift away from our long- standing pay for performance strategy, given the unique challenges we faced in 2016 as outlined above, including the need to structure compensatory retention and reward incentives within the parameters of the merger agreement with Aetna, the Organization & Compensation Committee, which we refer to as the Committee, made the decision to approve certain adjustments to our GAAP financial results (consistent with our publicly-announced financial results) for unusual events and revisions to our operating plan that occurred during the fiscal year for purposes of calculating results under our 2016 annual cash incentive program and the vesting of performance-based restricted stock units granted in 2014 for the 2014-2016 performance period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additional detail regarding each of these adjustments is disclosed below in the applicable sections.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When making these decisions, the Committee considered the challenging operating conditions when making these decisions, concluding that excluding the impact of certain items for purposes of calculating the payouts under the 2014-2016 performance-based restricted stock units
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) was consistent with past practice and appropriate as these events were not contemplated when establishing the ROIC-WACC incentive targets, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) resulted from external events beyond the Companys control, related to the proposed transaction with Aetna, or relate to non-strategic assets of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For more information, please refer to the sections entitled, Elements of Compensation  2016 Incentive Plan Results and Elements of Compensation  Long-Term Equity Awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, given the challenges of setting three-year performance targets during a period of regulatory review for the Aetna transaction, and of converting performance targets over to the surviving company if the transaction were to be consummated, the Committee determined not to grant performance-based restricted stock units in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With these compensation actions, we were able to manage through the challenging environment with limited key talent losses, while maintaining high levels of associate engagement, and produced financial results exceeding managements initial expectations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: How We Determine Pay
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of the Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee acts on behalf of the Board of Directors to establish the compensation of our executive officers and provides oversight of our compensation philosophy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviews and approves our goals and objectives relevant to the compensation of our CEO, evaluates the CEOs performance in light of those goals and objectives, and, either as a Committee or together with the other independent directors, determines and approves the CEOs compensation level based on this evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee also makes recommendations to the Board with respect to the CEOs and other executive officers base compensation, incentive-compensation plans and equity-based plans and approves programs for our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee administers the Humana Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Management Incentive Compensation Plan, or MIP, annually selecting those executive officer and other key executives eligible to participate in the MIP and establishing specific performance targets based on predetermined business goals aligned to our annual operating plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee has sole discretion to determine the form, amount and terms of each award, which need not be uniform among the persons eligible to receive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee independently makes all compensation decisions with respect to our executive officers based upon enterprise-wide and individual performance, as well as the appropriate levels of compensation necessary to attract and retain exceptional talent.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee does not have established target ratios or a formula for calculating the relative compensation of the CEO as compared to each Named Executive Officer, or for each Named Executive Officer as compared to any other.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Instead, the Committee reviews historical pay ratios and external market data to ensure that the compensation of our Named Executive Officers remains relatively proportional, considering all factors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following a discussion among the Committee, the CEO and our independent compensation consultant, the Committee considers this informal analysis of internal pay equity in making executive compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee concluded that the relative levels of compensation among the Named Executive Officers were appropriate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of the Independent Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee retains an independent compensation consultant, Willis Towers Watson, to ensure that the Committee has objective information needed to make informed decisions in the best interests of stockholders based on compensation trends and practices in public companies, and to provide assistance to the Committee in evaluating our executive compensation policy and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committees independent compensation consultant provides guidance to the Committee when determining the compensation of the Chief Executive Officer and the other Named Executive Officers and provides market data to help the Committee determine appropriate target compensation levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Representatives of Willis Towers Watson attended all meetings of the Committee in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Role of Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To determine compensation for our Named Executive Officers, other than our Chief Executive Officer, or CEO, the Committee solicits input from the CEO regarding the duties and responsibilities of our Named Executive Officers and the results of his evaluations of their performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The CEO, with guidance from the Companys Human Resources Department, discusses with the Committee the CEOs recommendations for the compensation of his direct reports and the rationale for those recommendations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, our CEO considers an analysis of internal pay equity in addition to external market data, taking into account each Named Executive Officers individual contributions, performance, potential, skills, judgment, leadership ability and competencies, and makes a recommendation to the Committee regarding relativity of compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of a Peer Group
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making compensation decisions for our Named Executive Officers, we use comparisons from competitors within our peer group, based on revenue size and market capitalization, which includes our closest industry competitors, to ensure that our compensation program is market-competitive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Using different screening criteria (e.g., line of business, industry, market cap, etc.) yields multiple perspectives that enrich our understanding of competitive executive pay practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each comparable company is reviewed by the Committee every year to ensure continued appropriateness of our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe our peer group is comprised of companies with whom we compete for talent and whose revenues, market capitalization, and business focus are similar to ours.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We conduct an annual advisory vote on executive compensation, commonly referred to as Say On Pay.

sentences.text: We take a holistic approach to compensation using a mix of all elements to achieve levels of direct compensation that are appropriate in the context of the Companys compensation philosophy and performance.

sentences.text: Design of Our Compensation Program
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Named Executive Officer compensation includes direct compensation that is:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Market-based  Competitive with our peer group and general industry standards, with total compensation targeted on average at market medians, but typically ranging from the 25  to 75  percentiles, depending on the level of competency, past and expected future contribution, and the competitive market for new talent; th th
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Competency-paced  Flexible enough to match the progress of fast-rising performers but resistant to salary advancement if competency levels remain static; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Contribution-driven  Reward those who make a difference, creating meaningful compensation distinctions among different levels of performance and achievement, while avoiding annual compensation actions that foster an entitlement mentality.

sentences.text: Highlighted below are some of the key elements of our compensation program that the Committee believes evidence strong corporate governance and prudent compensation decisions.

sentences.text: We also identify certain pay practices that we do not follow because w believe they do not serve our stockholders long-term interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: WHAT WE DO   WHAT WE DONT DO     Double-trigger change in control agreements for our Named Executive Officers that provide for cash severance only upon termination following a change in control, and equity agreements that provide for acceleration only upon termination following a change in control        No single trigger vesting of equity or cash severance payments upon a change in control for awards after July 2, 2015     More than 80% of our Named Executive Officer pay is at risk        Compensation programs do not encourage unreasonable risk taking, confirmed by annual compensation risk assessment     Clawbacks that allow us to recoup cash-based compensation earned by an executive officer in the event of a material restatement of our financials resulting from the misconduct or fraud on the part of that officer        Our policies prohibit all hedging transactions designed to offset any decrease in the market value of our securities, and directors and executive officers are prohibited from holding Humana securities in margin accounts or pledging Humana securities as collateral     Stock ownership guidelines that link a significant amount of executive officer net worth to our strategic and financial success        No tax gross-ups for our Named Executive Officers, and no excessive perquisites, as all have a specific business rationale     Use of tally sheets to effectively analyze the compensation each executive officer has accumulated to date and to fully understand the amount the executive officer could accumulate in the future        Other than our CEO, our executive officers do not have employment agreements    Regular engagement with our stockholders to strengthen our understanding of stockholder concerns      No stock option repricing, reloads or exchanges without stockholder approval

sentences.text: To enable determination of the pre-closing MIP payment had the proposed transaction with Aetna closed during 2016, the Committee pre-established monthly and annual EPS metrics to provide a direct link between executive compensation and a key performance measure of the Company.

sentences.text: Consumer Health Participation Performance Metric
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The consumer health participation performance metric, or CHP, focuses on increasing the levels of participation by our members in various programs and services proven to improve health outcomes and lower the cost of care.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee maintained the five leading indicators of health outcomes to measure CHP performance that were introduced in 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These were selected on the basis of being applicable to the medical lines of our business, and the Companys overall business outcomes, and were consistent with furtherance of our integrated care delivery strategy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, they are closely aligned to the Companys strategic vision of improving the health of the communities we serve 20% by 2020 and by making it easier for people to achieve their best health.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the Committee believed it to be culturally important to pay for performance associated with improving health outcomes for our members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.5% Humana Pharmacy Usage    We believe that the use of Humana Pharmacy, our mail order pharmacy service, by our members leads to higher medication adherence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 22.5%   Humana Vitality Participation      Maintaining health and wellness is critical for our group members, and the Vitality program connects them to online health programs and services designed to improve and maintain their health.

sentences.text: A Closer Look at How We Determine Equity Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee, with the assistance of our independent compensation consultant, determines the aggregate amounts and terms of equity compensation awards for each Named Executive Officer following a review of stock programs and competitive practices at peer companies, as well as the outstanding equity information for each executive officer using tally sheets to examine the value of prior compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The grant value of each award reflects the executives level of responsibility and past and expected future contributions to the Companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making equity awards, the Committee generally reviews and approves the dollar value of an award to be granted to each Named Executive Officer, based on the internal and external benchmarking of total compensation discussed above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shares subject to the award is then determined using the fair market value of the award on the grant date, which, in the case of stock options, is determined using a Black-Scholes methodology.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of our merger agreement with Aetna, the aggregate amount of our 2016 equity awards was limited to a specific level.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Given this limitation, the Committee determined not to change the relative size of equity awards for our Named Executive Officers in 2016, remaining consistent with the prior years grants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The companies in our peer group utilize a mix of stock options, restricted stock units, performance shares/units, and cash incentive plans for long-term incentive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notwithstanding the limitations with respect to our equity award program as described above, the following summarizes the results of the Committees external benchmarking with respect to long-term incentive compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Closer Look at our 2016 Equity Awards Mix
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, pursuant to the terms of our merger agreement with Aetna, we awarded our Named Executive Officers long-term incentive grants in the form an equal split of stock options and restricted stock unit awards (based on grant date value as described below).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that for 2016, this mix provided an appropriate balance between attraction, retention and motivation of executives and the creation of stockholder value given the significant uncertainty facing our organization and the need to retain our key talent during a period of lengthy regulatory review.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the proposed merger with Aetna and the challenges associated with structuring such awards in that operating environment, the Committee did not award performance-based restricted stock units to our Named Executive Officers in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A Closer Look at the Performance of our 2014-2016 Performance-Based Restricted Stock Unit Awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2014, the Committee granted performance-based equity awards to our then-serving named executive officers, with performance criteria for these awards based upon three-year cumulative goals for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) strategic membership growth and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) return on invested capital (ROIC) less our weighted average cost of capital (WACC), further linking executive compensation to the Companys performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The following discloses the three-year cumulative goals included in the 2014-2016 performance-based awards, with incremental payout between steps (depending upon performance, up to 156% of the target performance-based awards may be earned):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Strategic Membership Growth      Achievement at 80% Level    Achievement at 100%  Level      546,000 members    683,000 members Financial: ROIC-WACC    >0.0%    Achievement at 64.0%    Achievement at 80.0%    1.0%    Achievement at 80.0%    Achievement at 100.0%    >3.0%    Achievement at 100.0%    Achievement at 156.0%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee based the performance goals on strategic membership growth and ROIC-WACC because the combined use of these metrics were the most comprehensive factors for driving sustainable growth and returns in our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Achievement of the goals would be challenging and would require superior performance at either the target or maximum payout levels, considering the historical membership growth rates of both Humana and the Medicare Advantage industry as a whole, our 2014-2016 strategic plan and the implications of various ROIC-WACC results on the implementation of that plan, and the degree to which the operating success of the Company would be reflected in achievement of each performance criteria.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee reviewed both the progress toward achievement of the performance goals under each of our outstanding performance-based restricted stock unit awards, as well as our need to retain our executive officers and other key associates during the prolonged regulatory review period for our proposed merger with Aetna.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: its meeting in December 2016, the Committee weighed these factors and determined that the results for the ROIC-WACC measure for the 2014-2016 performance-based equity awards would be adjusted to exclude the effects of certain non-strategic business results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The results for ROIC-WACC were adjusted to exclude the effect of our 2016 write-off of certain receivables associated with the risk corridor premium stabilization program established under the Affordable Care Act, strengthening of our reserves associated with our non-strategic long-term care business, certain integration planning and transaction expenses in connection with the proposed transaction with Aetna, and the also the beneficial effect of a new Financial Accounting Standard Board (FASB) pronouncement regarding the accounting for the tax effect of stock-based compensation (for additional detail on these exclusions and the rationale behind the decision, please refer to the section entitled, Annual Cash Incentives  2016 Cash Incentive Plan Results in this proxy statement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee approved the application of certain exceptions to previous years cash incentive plan results to the ROIC-WACC measure for purposes of the 2014-2016 performance-based equity awards, in each case as disclosed in the Companys proxy statement for the relevant fiscal year and the Companys periodic earnings releases.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, the Committee agreed that excluding the impact of these items for purposes of calculating the payouts under the 2014-2016 performance-based restricted stock unit awards
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) was consistent with past practice and appropriate as these events were not contemplated when establishing the ROIC-WACC incentive targets,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) resulted from external events beyond the Companys control, related to the proposed transaction with Aetna, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) related to non-strategic assets of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After the adjustments, the Company achieved strategic membership growth of 786,000 members, and ROIC-WACC of 1.4%, when adjusted as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, the Committee established the total amount of shares of restricted stock earned by the Named Executive Officers under their respective 2014-2016 performance-based restricted stock units at 111% of target amounts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The accounting effect of the modification for each Named Executive Officer is detailed in the tables entitled Summary Compensation Table and Grants of Plan- Based Awards in this proxy statement, in addition to equity granted in the ordinary course in early 2016 as part of our annual long- term incentive program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Compensation Considerations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Severance/Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Broussard
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In July 2015, we entered into an amendment to our existing amended and restated employment agreement with Mr. Broussard, our President and CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We refer to the amended and restated employment agreement, as amended, in this proxy statement as the Broussard Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Broussard Agreement governs any severance or change in control payments for Mr. Broussard.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There are no excise tax gross-up provisions in the Broussard Agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a description of the severance benefits to which Mr. Broussard would be entitled upon a termination of employment, see the section entitled Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control of the Company in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Named Executive Officers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains a severance policy, which we refer to as the Severance Policy, for all of our Named Executive Officers, except for Mr. Broussard (whose severance is covered by the Broussard Agreement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Severance Policy provides our Named Executive Officers with severance benefits upon certain qualifying terminations of employment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benefits under the Severance Policy are calculated based on years of service with the Company, with a minimum of one year of annual base salary for any Named Executive Officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with receiving benefits pursuant to the Severance Policy, the Named Executive Officer is required to enter into a written agreement that forbids him or her from competing for a period of twelve months and includes specific
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: provisions relating to non-disparagement and cooperation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a discussion of the payments each of our Named Executive Officers would receive in the event of a termination of employment that qualifies for severance pursuant to the Severance Policy, see the section entitled Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control of the Company in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, because we operate in a highly competitive, complex and consolidating industry, we have entered into change in control agreements, or CIC Agreements, with all of our executive officers, including our Named Executive Officers (except for Mr. Broussard, whose severance in the event of a Change in Control would be governed by the Broussard Agreement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to the CIC Agreements, in the event that the executives employment is terminated by the Company without Cause or by the executive for Good Reason within twenty-four months following a Change in Control (as each term is defined in the CIC Agreements), or by the Company without Cause under certain circumstances prior to a Change in Control, certain benefits will be provided to these executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the CIC Agreements, in the event of a termination of employment under the circumstances described above, these executive officers are entitled to receive a severance payment in the amount of one and one half times the sum of each executive officers annual base salary and the target incentive compensation payable to him or her for the year in which termination occurs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, health, life and disability insurance coverage would be provided, generally for a two-year period following termination unless the participant dies or is eligible for comparable coverage from another source.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the CIC Agreements (including the Change in Control provisions of the Broussard Agreement) provide for cash severance benefits payable only upon a double trigger (i.e., two events must occur before any severance payment is made: the executive officer must be terminated or constructively terminated as described in the CIC Agreement, and such termination must have occurred during a specified period after the Company entered into a definitive agreement, the consummation of which would result in a Change in Control, or the Change in Control has occurred), although the executives may be entitled to accelerated vesting of equity compensation granted prior to July 2, 2015, solely upon the occurrence of a Change in Control pursuant to the terms of the applicable award agreement as described in more detail in this proxy statement (equity compensation granted after July 2, 2015, provides for double trigger vesting).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee opted for a double-trigger, rather than providing for payments solely on the basis of a Change in Control (so called single trigger), because we believe this to be more consistent with the purpose of encouraging the continued employment and focus of our Named Executive Officers following a Change in Control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the CIC Agreements for our Named Executive Officers allowed our executives to devote their time to the duties of running our Company without being distracted by any potential Change in Control, and also have a significant retention value to the Company with respect to our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the severance multiples provided for in the CIC Agreements are appropriate because they are comparable to similarly situated senior executives across U.S. industries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For a discussion of the payments each of our Named Executive Officers would receive in the event of a termination of employment in connection with a Change in Control or in the event of a termination of employment in other circumstances, see the section entitled Potential Payments Upon Termination or Change in Control of the Company in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also provide certain other benefits to our Named Executive Officers as part of our competitive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amounts expended through these programs are explained in the footnotes that follow the Summary Compensation Table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As noted, not all Named Executive Officers participate in each benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, these benefits included limited personal use of Company aircraft for the Named Executive Officers, an annual physical, a matching charitable gift program, supplemental life insurance benefits, financial planning assistance, and reimbursement for relocation.

sentences.text: Compensation Governance and Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Clawbacks
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Committee has adopted a clawback policy to supplement those provisions set forth in the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 and related regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The clawback policy:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: applies to all executive officers;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: permits the recoupment of compensation in the event of a material restatement of the Companys financials as a result of the misconduct or fraud on the part of the executive officer;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: permits the recoupment of all cash-based incentives earned by the executive officer involved in the misconduct or fraud during the twelve month period following the first public issuance of the financials that are the subject of the restatement; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: grants discretion to the Committee with respect to the application of the clawback provision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hedging and Pledging Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We consider it improper for our associates to engage in short-term, speculative transactions in our securities, and therefore prohibit short sales of Company securities, as well as transactions designed to hedge or offset any decreases in the market value of Company securities, including transactions in puts, calls or other derivative securities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We therefore have a policy prohibiting directors and executive officers from engaging in certain monetization transactions, including holding Company securities in margin accounts or pledging Company securities as collateral.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock Ownership Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that linking a significant amount of an executives current and potential future net worth to the Companys success, as reflected in the stock price, gives the executive a stake similar to that of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consequently, the Board of Directors has established stock ownership guidelines for the Companys executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expressed as a multiple of base salary, minimum levels of Humana common stock ownership, excluding Shares held in retirement accounts and unexercised stock options, are:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chief Executive Officer:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Direct reports to the CEO (including all NEOs):
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the stock ownership guidelines provide that any Shares owned by an executive officer (or shares received upon the exercise of stock options or vesting of restricted stock or restricted stock units, less an amount to cover current tax liabilities) must be held by the executive officer until the relevant multiple is reached and thereafter maintained.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration of Advisory Votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act, enacted on July 21, 2010 (which we refer to as the Dodd- Frank Act), requires that we include in our proxy statement a non-binding advisory stockholder vote to approve the compensation of our Named Executive Officers as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section, the compensation tables and the accompanying narrative disclosure, set forth in the proxy statement for that meeting (commonly referred to as a Say-on-Pay vote).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2011 Annual Meeting, our stockholders voted for the approval of an annual advisory vote with respect to our Named Executive Officer compensation (instead of a Say-on-Pay vote every two or three years), and our Board of Directors considered and accepted this stockholder vote and managements recommendation regarding the frequency of future stockholder advisory votes with respect to our Named Executive Officer compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since this stockholder vote on the frequency of future stockholder advisory votes with respect to Named Executive Officer compensation occurred six years ago, as required under the Dodd-Frank Act, we have included in this proxy statement our Boards recommendation that our stockholders approve, on an advisory basis, the continuation of an annual Say-on-Pay advisory vote with respect to the compensation of our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Last year, at our 2016 Annual Meeting of Stockholders, our stockholders again voted their approval of the compensation of our Named Executive Officers with approximately 97% of the votes cast voting in favor of the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considered the results of this advisory vote in determining the Companys compensation policies and decisions, and has determined that these policies and decisions are and have been appropriate and in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Consultants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee retains an independent compensation consultant to ensure that the Committee has objective information needed to make informed decisions in the best interests of stockholders based on compensation trends and practices in public companies, and to provide assistance to the Committee in evaluating our executive compensation policy and programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ole of the Independent Compensation Consultan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Advise on the interpretation of various rules and regulations impacting executive compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Review with the Committee managements proposals and initiatives
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Provides certain data on competitive pay levels
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Undertakes special projects on behalf of the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with the Committees Charter, the Committee has the sole authority to determine the compensation for, and to terminate the services of, the independent compensation consultant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, the independent compensation consultant for the Committee was Willis Towers Watson, and a representative of Willis Towers Watson attended all of the regularly-scheduled Committee meetings in 2016, including, when invited, executive sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, in 2016 we again retained Aon Hewitt to provide certain advice to management regarding executive compensation, independent of advice provided to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With regard to Willis Towers Watson and Aon Hewitt, the Committee has considered certain factors to determine whether such firms service as a compensation consultant raised a conflict of interest, including, among other things:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the firm provided other services to Humana;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The amount of fees received by the firm from Humana, as a percentage of such firms total revenue;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The firms policies and procedures that are designed to prevent conflicts of interest;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the firms representatives providing services to the Committee have any business or personal relationship with a member of the Committee;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the firms representatives providing services to the Committee own Humana stock; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether the firms representatives providing services to the Committee, or the firm itself, have any business or personal relationship with any of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we paid Willis Towers Watson approximately $168,000 for executive compensation advisory support services provided to the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Committee considered certain advisory services provided by Willis Towers Watson, including corporate risk and broking and data services fees, in addition to risk consulting, for which services we paid approximately $1,475,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering the above factors, the Committee determined that the service as a compensation consultant of each of Willis Towers Watson and Aon Hewitt did not raise any conflict of interest.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Severance Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officer severance policy, which we refer to as the Severance Policy, was adopted in 1999.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Severance Policy covers all of our Named Executive Officers, except for Mr. Broussard (whose payments as of December 31, 2016 would have been covered by the Broussard Agreement, as described above).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Severance Policy, an executive officer involuntarily terminated for reasons not meeting the definition of good cause in the Severance Policy will receive one years base salary plus one additional months base salary for each of the first six full years of service up to a maximum of eighteen months base pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terminated executive officer would remain eligible to receive prorated incentive compensation to be paid at the normal time after year end, provided plan targets and other plan provisions were met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since the calculations in the table assume a December 31, 2016 termination, incentive compensation would be paid for the full year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Severance Policy, Mr. Murray would be entitled to one years base salary plus six months base salary, since he has been with the Company for more than six years, Mr. Huval would be entitled to one years base salary plus four months base salary, since he joined the Company effective December 31, 2012, Mr. Kane would be entitled to one years base salary plus two months base salary, since he joined the Company in June 2014, and Ms. Bilney would be entitled to one years base salary plus three months base salary, since she joined the Company in April 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These amounts are included in the table.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the Named Executive Officers were terminated in connection with a change in control, they would be eligible to receive benefits pursuant to their respective CIC Agreements (described in further detail in Note 4 below) instead of pursuant to the Severance Policy.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with the receipt of any severance payments described above, the Named Executive Officer would be required to enter into a written agreement that would forbid him or her from competing with us for a period of twelve months.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such an agreement would also contain other provisions intended to prohibit the Named Executive Officer from making any disparaging remarks about us, and would also have clauses regarding cooperation and specific enforcement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The treatment of these equity awards will vary depending upon the nature of the termination.

sentences.text: As noted above, the treatment of Mr. Broussards outstanding equity awards is governed by the Broussard Agreement (described in Note 1 above).

sentences.text: Voluntary Termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Stock Plans, upon a voluntary termination for reasons not having to do with Cause or Retirement, in each case as defined below, each Named Executive Officer would have 90 days to exercise any vested options, but in no event beyond the expiration date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any unvested restricted stock units would be forfeited upon a voluntary termination for reasons not having to do with Cause or Retirement, in each case as defined below; provided, however, that the Committee may determine, in its sole discretion, that the restrictions on some or all of such unvested shares of unvested restricted stock units shall immediately lapse upon such termination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Involuntary Termination without Cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Stock Plans, upon an involuntary termination by the Company for reasons other than Cause, all unvested stock options held by our Named Executive Officers would be forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any unvested restricted stock units held by our Named Executive Officers would also be forfeited.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, our equity grant agreements contain non-compete and non-solicit provisions that only remain in full force and effect following an involuntary termination by the Company for reasons other than Cause if we pay an amount at least equal to the Named Executive Officers then current annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any such amounts that could be paid post-termination to enforce non-compete and non-solicit provisions are not included in the table above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Involuntary Termination for Cause.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Stock Plans, in the event of termination for Cause, all options and unvested restricted stock units are forfeited for all Named Executive Officers, regardless of whether the options are vested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Stock Plans, Cause is defined as a felony conviction of a Participant or the failure of a Participant to contest prosecution for a felony, or a Participants willful misconduct or dishonesty, any of which is determined by the Committee to be directly and materially harmful to the business or reputation of the Company or its Subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retirement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Stock Plans, an eligible Retirement means a combination of age and years of service with the Company totaling 65 or greater, with a minimum required age of 55 and a minimum requirement of five years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to grants of options prior to July 2, 2015, in the event of an eligible Retirement by a Named Executive Officer, any outstanding options
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For awards granted after July 2, 2015, in the Event of an eligible Retirement by a Named Executive Officer, any outstanding options and restricted stock units will vest pro rata.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Death or Disability.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Stock Plans, in the event of death or Disability of a Named Executive Officer, all outstanding options shall become immediately exercisable in full and the Named Executive Officer, or his estate or representative shall have two years to exercise the options regardless of the expiration date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Stock Plans, in the event of death or Disability of a Named Executive Officer, any unvested restricted stock units shall immediately vest, and any unvested shares of performance-based restricted stock units will vest at the maximum level.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Audit Committee currently is comprised of four directors.

sentences.text: All members are independent and are financially literate as defined in the NYSE listing standards.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As set forth in its Charter, our Audit Committee is directly responsible for the appointment, compensation, retention and oversight of the work of the independent registered public accounting firm engaged to prepare the audit report or perform other audit, review or attestation services.

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has retained PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, or PwC, as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm for fiscal 2017.

sentences.text: The Audit Committee reviews Humanas financial reporting processes on behalf of the Board of Directors.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management is responsible for the financial statements and the reporting process, including its assessment of our internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL TWO: RATIFICATION OF APPOINTMENT OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Background
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors, in accordance with the recommendation of its Audit Committee, believes that the continued retention of PwC as the Companys independent registered public accounting firm is in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders, and therefore has appointed PwC to audit the consolidated financial statements of the Company for the year ending December 31, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making this appointment, the Board considered the performance and independence of PwC, including whether any non-audit services performed by PwC are compatible with maintaining independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee and Board of Directors believe that PwC has invaluable long-term knowledge of Humana.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While preserving that knowledge, partners and employees of PwC engaged in audits of Humana are periodically changed, giving Humana access to new expertise, experience and perspectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are asking our stockholders to ratify the appointment of PwC as our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although ratification is not required by our Charter, Bylaws, Delaware law or otherwise, the Board is submitting the appointment of PwC to our stockholders for ratification because we value our stockholders views on our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If our stockholders fail to ratify the appointment, it will be considered as a non-binding recommendation to the Board and the Audit Committee to consider the appointment of a different firm for fiscal year 2018.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if the appointment is ratified, the Board and the Audit Committee may select a different independent registered public accounting firm at any time during the year if it determines that such a change would be in the best interests of the Company and our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect that representatives of PwC will be present at the Annual Meeting and will be afforded the opportunity to make a statement if they desire to do so and to respond to appropriate questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required and Recommendation of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of the votes present and entitled to vote with respect to the proposal is required for the ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares not present at the meeting have no effect on the ratification of the appointment of PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP, while shares voting abstain will be counted as against votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to NYSE regulations, brokers and other NYSE member organizations have discretionary voting power over the ratification of the appointment of the Companys independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR THE RATIFICATION OF THE APPOINTMENT OF PRICEWATERHOUSECOOPERS LLP AS THE COMPANYS INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTING FIRM.

sentences.text: Background
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Dodd-Frank Act required that we include in our 2011 proxy statement a non-binding advisory stockholder vote with respect to the frequency of future advisory votes regarding the compensation of our Named Executive Officers as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section, the compensation tables and the accompanying narrative disclosure, set forth in this proxy statement (commonly referred to as Say-on-Pay).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2011 Annual Meeting, held on April 21, 2011, our stockholders recommended an annual Say-on-Pay vote, and our Board of Directors subsequently adopted that recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2017, we are therefore asking our stockholders to vote on the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders of Humana Inc. approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis section, the compensation tables, and the accompanying narrative disclosure, set forth in the Companys proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The compensation of our Named Executive Officers is disclosed in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables, and the related disclosures contained in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in those disclosures, our philosophy is that compensation should be market-based, competency-paced and contribution-driven.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation programs are designed to challenge participants as well as reward them for superior performance for our Company and our stockholders, with an emphasis on pay-for-performance principles to align the interests of our Named Executive Officers with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our compensation practices and policies enable us to attract and retain talented and experienced executives to lead the Company successfully in a competitive environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Your vote on this Proposal Three is an advisory one, and therefore is not binding on the Company, the Organization & Compensation Committee, or the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote will not be construed to create or imply any change to the fiduciary duties of the Company or the Board, or to create or imply any additional fiduciary duties for the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, our Board and our Organization & Compensation Committee value the opinions of our stockholders, and intend to consider any stockholder concerns evidenced by this vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will continue to evaluate and disclose whether any actions are necessary to address those concerns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required and Recommendation of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of the votes present and entitled to vote with respect to the proposal is required for the approval of the non-binding advisory vote with respect to the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares not present at the meeting and broker non-votes have no effect on the approval of this non-binding advisory vote, while abstentions will count as votes against.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to NYSE regulations, brokers do not have discretionary voting power over this proposal, and therefore, if you hold Shares through a broker or other NYSE member organization and do not provide voting instructions to your broker or other NYSE member organization, your Shares will not be voted with respect to this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you timely submit a signed proxy but fail to specify instructions to vote with respect to this proposal, the accompanying proxy will be voted FOR this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS UNANIMOUSLY RECOMMENDS A VOTE FOR THE PROPOSAL TO APPROVE THE COMPENSATION OF THE COMPANYS NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS AS DESCRIBED IN THE COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS, THE COMPENSATION TABLES, AND THE RELATED DISCLOSURES CONTAINED IN THIS PROXY STATEMENT.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL FOUR: NON-BINDING ADVISORY VOTE WITH RESPECT TO THE COMPENSATION OF THE COMPANYS NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2011 Annual Meeting, held on April 21, 2011, our stockholders recommended an annual Say-on-Pay vote, and our Board of Directors subsequently adopted that recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since that vote occurred six years ago, the Dodd-Frank Act requires that we include in this proxy statement another non-binding advisory stockholder vote regarding the frequency with which the Companys stockholders will have a future advisory vote with respect to the compensation of our Named Executive Officers, as provided for in Proposal 3 above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are therefore asking our stockholders to vote on the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders of Humana Inc. determine, on an advisory basis, that the frequency with which the stockholders of the Company shall have a future advisory vote with respect to the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers set forth in the Companys proxy statement is:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choice 4  abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company asks that you support an annual non-binding, advisory stockholder vote on the compensation of our Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In formulating its recommendation to continue with an annual advisory vote, our board of directors considered that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation allows our stockholders to provide us with their direct input on our compensation philosophy, policies and practices as disclosed in the proxy statement every year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the advisory vote on executive compensation is, at its essence, a communication vehicle, and communication is most useful when it is received in a consistent manner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Furthermore, at this time, we believe that an annual advisory vote on executive compensation continues to provide the highest level of transparency, accountability and constructive communication by enabling the vote to correspond to the compensation information presented in the accompanying proxy statement for each annual stockholders meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Additionally, an annual advisory vote on executive compensation is consistent with our policy of seeking input from, and engaging in discussions with, our stockholders on corporate governance matters and our executive compensation philosophy, policies and practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, we believe that our executive compensation philosophy, policies and practices are consistent with the long-term objectives of our stockholders, and therefore welcome their views on a regular basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As with your vote on Proposal 3 above, your vote on this Proposal 4 is advisory, and therefore not binding on the Company, our Organization & Compensation Committee, or our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote will not be construed to create or imply any change to the fiduciary duties of the Company or the Board, or to create or imply any additional fiduciary duties for the Company or the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nevertheless, our Board and our Organization & Compensation Committee value the opinions of our stockholders, and, to the extent there is a significant vote in favor of one frequency over the other options, intends to consider our stockholders concerns in the evaluation of any appropriate next steps.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required and Recommendation of Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The frequency (every one, two, or three years) receiving the highest number of votes will be deemed to be the choice of our stockholders with respect to the non-binding, advisory vote on the frequency of voting with respect to the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shares not present at the meeting and Shares voting abstain or broker non-votes have no effect on the approval of this non-binding advisory vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to current NYSE regulations, brokers and other NYSE member organizations do not have discretionary voting power over the approval of the non-binding, advisory vote on the frequency of voting with respect to the compensation of the Companys Named Executive Officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, if you hold Shares through a broker or other NYSE member organization
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and do not provide voting instructions to your, broker or other NYSE member organization, your Shares may not be voted with respect to this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you timely submit a signed proxy but fail to specify instructions to vote with respect to this proposal, the accompanying proxy will be voted FOR Choice 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL FIVE: PROXY ACCESS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Background
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have been notified by a group of stockholders that they intend to submit the resolution set forth below at the Annual Meeting for action by the stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to Rule 14a-8(l)(1) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, we will provide the name address and number of shares of our common stock held by the proponents of the stockholder proposal set forth below promptly upon receipt of a written or oral request.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Requests should be submitted to Humana Inc., Attention: Corporate Secretary, 500 W. Main Street, Louisville, Kentucky 40202.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED: Shareholders of Humana Inc. (the Company) ask the board of directors (the Board) to take the steps necessary to adopt a proxy access bylaw.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Such a bylaw shall require the Company to include in proxy materials prepared for a shareholder meeting at which directors are to be elected the name, Disclosure and Statement (as defined herein) of any person nominated for election to the board by a shareholder or group (the Nominator) that meets the criteria established below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company shall allow shareholders to vote on such nominee on the Companys proxy card.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The number of shareholder-nominated candidates appearing in proxy materials shall not exceed the larger of two or one quarter of the directors then serving.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This bylaw, which shall supplement existing rights under Company bylaws, should provide that a Nominator must:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: a) have beneficially owned 3% or more of the Companys outstanding common stock continuously for at least three years before submitting the nomination;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: b) give the Company, within the time period identified in its bylaws, written notice of the information required by the bylaws and any Securities and Exchange Commission rules about
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the nominee, including consent to being named in the proxy materials and to serving as director if elected; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the Nominator, including proof it owns the required shares (the Disclosure); and c) certify that
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) it will assume liability stemming from any legal or regulatory violation arising out of the Nominators communications with the Company shareholders, including the Disclosure and Statement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) it will comply with all applicable laws and regulations if it uses soliciting material other than the Companys proxy materials; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) to the best of its knowledge, the required shares were acquired in the ordinary course of business and not to change or influence control at the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominator may submit with the Disclosure a statement not exceeding 500 words in support of each nominee (the Statement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board shall adopt procedures for promptly resolving disputes over whether notice of a nomination was timely, whether the Disclosure and Statement satisfy the bylaw and applicable federal regulations, and the priority to be given to multiple nominations exceeding the one-quarter limit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholder Supporting Statement
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe proxy access will make directors more accountable and enhance shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A 2014 study by the CFA Institute concluded that proxy access could raise overall US market capitalization by up to $140.3 billion if adopted market-wide, with little cost or disruption.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (http://www.cfapubs.org/doi/pdf/10.2469/ccb.v2014.n9.1)
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposed terms are similar to those in vacated SEC Rule 14a-11 (https://www.sec.gov/rules/final/2010/33-9136.pdf).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The SEC, following extensive analysis and input from market participants, determined that those terms struck the proper balance of providing shareholders with viable proxy access while containing appropriate safeguards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proposed terms enjoy strong investor support and company acceptance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Between January 2015 and October 2016, 95 similar shareholder proposals received majority votes and at least 270 companies of various sizes across industries enacted bylaws with similar terms.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We urge shareholders to vote FOR this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Vote Required and Recommendation of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The affirmative vote of a majority of the votes cast on the proposal is required to adopt the resolution.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, Shares not present at the meeting and Shares voting abstain or broker non-votes have no effect on the approval of this non-binding advisory vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to NYSE regulations, brokers do not have discretionary voting power over this proposal, and therefore, if you hold Shares through a broker or other NYSE member organization and do not provide voting instructions to your broker or other NYSE organization, your Shares may not be voted with respect to this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you timely submit a signed proxy but fail to specify instructions to vote with respect to this proposal, the accompanying proxy will be voted AGAINST this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS WILL OPPOSE THIS PROPOSAL IF IT IS INTRODUCED AT THE 2017 ANNUAL MEETING AND RECOMMENDS A VOTE AGAINST THIS PROPOSAL FOR THE FOLLOWING REASONS:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is committed to being stewards of strong corporate governance practices and recognizes that proxy access is an emerging governance practice important to many investors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of our ongoing dialogue with our stockholder, our management and Board conduct outreach in the ordinary course to our stockholders to discuss the Companys business strategy, Board and corporate governance practices and executive compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We find this engagement to be an extremely helpful communication mechanism, and believe it is important that we continue dialogue with stockholders and monitor corporate governance developments in the best interests of the Company and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have also monitored the adoption of proxy access to understand how it will be used in practice or what unintended consequences may result from implementing particular proxy access provisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are also evaluating the interplay proxy access would have with the existing thoughtful and deliberate method of director candidate selection and nomination process that our Nominating & Corporate Governance Committee currently follows.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This process is designed to ensure each candidate is qualified with a robust combination of professional experience, skills, diversity of backgrounds and high ethical standards that meet the needs of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annually, our Board conducts a self-evaluation to ensure the continued effective collaboration of our Board members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board highly values stockholder viewpoints and has considered feedback received over the years in establishing strong Board and governance practices that provide stockholders with important rights and abilities, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors are elected annually;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are elected by majority vote standard;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are able to call a special meeting;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are able to suggest director candidates through the Nominating & Corporate Governance Committees director nomination process; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stockholders are able to submit proposals for consideration at our annual meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board adopted these best practices in a deliberate manner to ensure all stockholder interests are represented and protected nd to minimize potential long-term negative consequences to our sound governance principles.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will continue to assess proxy access developments in order to gain a clear understanding of how proxy access would impac our corporate governance and, ultimately, the creation of long-term stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR THESE REASONS, THE BOARD BELIEVES THAT THIS PROPOSAL IS NOT IN THE BEST INTERESTS OF HUMANA OR OUR STOCKHOLDERS, AND THEREFORE RECOMMENDS A VOTE AGAINST THIS PROPOSAL.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
